metadata.Title: CVE-2022-23221 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
H2 Console before 2.1.210 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a jdbc:h2:mem JDBC URL containing the IGNORE_UNKNOWN_SETTINGS=TRUE;FORBID_CREATION=FALSE;INIT=RUNSCRIPT substring, a different vulnerability than CVE-2021-42392.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-23221` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libh2-java - 1.4.197-4+deb10u1build0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: h2database package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.197-4+deb10u1build0.20.04.1').
